normalised: That’s where a solid payment gateway comes in. Think of it as the friendly cashier in your online shop, ensuring smooth transactions between your customer's bank and your business account. It handles everything from processing credit and debit card payments to U P I transfers and even those shiny new digital wallets everyone in Mumbai's using these days.

normalised: Choosing the right gateway is essential. You wouldn't want to offer only cash payments during Onam celebrations, would you? People want options! Consider things like transaction fees (nobody likes hidden charges, not even Sharmaji!), security (absolutely paramount!), and integration with your existing e-commerce platform (Shopify, WooCommerce, etc.).

normalised: Some popular options in India include Razorpay, Pay U, and C C Avenue. They all have their pros and cons, so do your research. Look at factors like settlement time (how quickly you get your money – crucial for managing cash flow), customer support (you'll want help when things go south!), and whether they support recurring payments (if you’re selling subscriptions, this is a must!). Also, see if they provide robust reporting. Knowing your peak sales times around Diwali, for instance, can help you optimize your inventory.
